title: Why dev mode does not mine automatically?
body:
I use dev mode for a long time, and it worked fine. 
But recently I updated the software, and delete old data folder to recreate whole data environment. I found the dev mode doesn't mine automatically whatever I set dev.period 0 or 1 or anything else. It just commit new mining work, and sealing paused, waiting for transactions, but never mine potential block.
I run geth on windows, does anybody has same problem with me?

Works for me, off latest `master`
```
$ geth --dev --dev.period 1  2>&1 | grep mined
```

Please provide your exact commandline args + logs about what is happening.

@holiman 
I'm sorry, my description is wrong.
`--dev.period 1` works fine, mined per second.
But `--dev.period 0` does not work.
I submitted two transaction, and there was no "mined potential block". 
I use `geth --datadir test-chain-dir --http --http.port "8545" --http.api personal,eth,net,web3 --dev --dev.period 0`,
I checked the mining status, it returned true.

Importantly, is that my node says `Commit new mining work                   number=1 sealhash=85e47b..964056 uncles=0 txs=1` (obs: `txs=1`), whereas your node says `Commit new mining work                   number=1 sealhash=e6b2ab..783a0a uncles=0 txs=0`. So for some reason, the tx you just submitted does not make it into the block. Which causes it to not mine. 

So, could you try the `console` and then do what I did: `eth.sendTransaction({from: eth.accounts[0], to:eth.accounts[0], value: 5})` ?

Actually, I was able to repro it 
```
> eth.sendTransaction({ from:eth.accounts[0], to: eth.accounts[0] , value: 5, gasPrice: 0}) 
INFO [11-08|20:39:29.761] Setting new local account                address=0xB06E452cee834E295dd908aDd559cEd4Aa8C2955

"0x50db9718cdf923fdbaac3aecf5afa4c038eeec66dfe47a2968afa7d0c9605306"
```
.... by sending a 0-gasprice transaction. The  miner won't accept those, but for some reason it does give the miner a kick to start sealing. Do you send them with 0 gasPrice? 

It's a bit odd that it isn't rejected by the pool -- it shouldn't even be noticed by the miner, IMO. 

EDIT: it's because we're "lenient" on price-checks for 'local' transactions. It's a bit "stupid nice", because a 0-gasprice transaction can never be included in post-1559 networks, since the basefee has a lower limit around `7`, iirc. So geth accepts it, but it will never be included.

@holiman 
Oh, yes, yes, I always set 0-gasprice when I use dev mode.
I see, if the gas price is too low, I need to replace it with more gas price to let geth include it into block. Excellent feature.
Sorry wasted your time, it's my fault.
Thank you, thank you so much.
